config.name: Tasty BBQ
config.copyright: Copyright Â© Dennis Reimann. Generated with UIengine.

index.title: Home
index.content:
Welcome to the

This is a sample project to showcase the basic functionality provided by the UIengine.

Also see the corresponding website, built with React and Next.js.

You can check out the source code on GitHub.

components/elements.title: Elements
components/elements.content: Primitives and basic components that are used as building blocks for more complex modules.

foundation/icons.title: Icons
foundation/icons.content:
Usage as React component: <Icon symbol="ICON_ID" />

For details see the icon component page.

Footer.title: Footer
Footer.content:
Footer

The Footer contains two panels: The tagcloud and links to our friends sites.

variants.title: Footer
variants.raw:
import React from 'react'
import Footer from '..'

export default props => <Footer {...props} />

Header.title: Header
Header.content: The Header contains the navbar and main hero image. On recipe pages it features the recipes main image in the background.

variants.title: Default
variants.raw:
import React from 'react'
import Header from '..'

export default () => <Header />

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.content:
Icon

Usage as React component: <Icon symbol="ICON_ID" />.

For an overview of available icons see the icon foundation page.

variants.title: Icon

Layout.title: Layout
Layout.content:
Layout

The Layout component provides the basic page structure. It receives the main content as children and wraps it inside a basic layout with Header, Socialbar and Footer.

Part of the layout are also the components Main and Sidebar, which wrap the particular content components.

variants.title: Default (without sidebar)
variants.description: Standard pages like the recipes list and details do not feature a sidebar.
variants.raw:
import React from 'react' import Layout, { Main } from '..' export default () => (

Here goes the main content

 )

variants.title: With Sidebar
variants.description: The sidebar appears on the home and about page.
variants.raw:
import React from 'react' import Layout, { Main, Sidebar } from '..' export default () => (

Here goes the main content

 )

variants.title: Navbar

Panel.title: Panel
Panel.content: Panels should be used in the sidebar or footer to group content (i.e. opening hours or the tag cloud).

variants.title: Panel
variants.raw:
import React from 'react' import Panel from '..' export default props => (

Panels should be used in the sidebar or footer to group content (i.e. opening hours or the tag cloud). The content is provided as children.

)

RecipeItem.title: RecipeItem
RecipeItem.content: The RecipeItem provides a quick impression of a recipe. There are two different visual representations: The default list view and the teaser.

variants.description: The default recipe item should be used in overview lists.

recipe.title: Gyros
recipe.abstract: Spare ribs meatball bacon, shankle ribeye porchetta frankfurter sausage biltong turkey pork chop leberkas alcatra pork tenderloin.

variants.title: Default

variants.description: Use the teaser when you want to display one or a few recipes prominently, like on the homepage.

recipe.title: Brisket Burnt Ends
recipe.abstract: Venison tenderloin fatback, jowl ball tip chuck ground round. Turducken venison bresaola, shankle strip steak buffalo doner biltong short loin.

variants.title: Teaser

Socialbar.title: Socialbar
Socialbar.content:
The Socialbar divides the main page content from the footer. It is a visual separator which also includes links to our social media outlets.

On recipe pages it features the recipes main image in the background.

variants.title: Default
variants.raw:
import React from 'react'
import Socialbar from '..'

export default props => <Socialbar {...props} />
